snippet: A convoy of Afghan officials was hit by a remote-controlled bomb before coming under small-arms fire for 15 minutes before the attackers escaped.
abstract: Taliban insurgents kill five Afghan education officials and wound three others during an ambush near the Pakistani border; officials were part of delegation visiting schools in Urgun, one of the largest districts in Paktika Province. (M)l

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY; Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, and an employee of The New York Times from Khost Province, Afghanistan

lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan -- Taliban insurgents ambushed a convoy of Afghan education officials traveling in a southeastern province close to the border with Pakistan on Tuesday, killing five officials and wounding three others, the police and the provincial governor's spokesman said. The officials were part of a delegation visiting schools in Urgun, one of the largest districts in Paktika Province, and were making the 40-mile return journey to the provincial capital when their convoy was hit by a remote-controlled bomb on a mountainous section of the road. They then came under small-arms fire for 15 minutes before the attackers escaped.

headline.main: Taliban Kill Five Officials With Schools Near Border
